title: Fix overly strict task_id regex requiring 3+ segments
description:
## Bug
The task_id validation regex requires minimum 3 hyphen-separated segments:
```
/^[a-z0-9]+(-[a-z0-9]+){2,}(\\.[\\w-]+)?$/
```

This breaks for projects with simple names like:
- `myproject` (1 segment)
- `my-project` (2 segments)

## Root Cause
Regex counts total segments, but project slug length is variable. The only thing that matters is the **hash suffix** - that's the unique identifier.

## Better Fix
Don't validate segment count at all. Either:

1. **Just validate the hash suffix exists** - ends with `-[a-z0-9]{10,}` or similar
2. **Don't validate format at all** - just check it's a non-empty string, let lookup fail if invalid
3. **Use smart ID resolution** - we already have `resolvePartialId()`, just accept any string and resolve it

Option 3 is best - we already built smart ID resolution. The regex validation is redundant and overly strict. Just pass whatever the user gives us to `resolvePartialId()` and let it find the match.

## Files
- packages/opencode-swarm-plugin/src/swarm-prompts.ts (WorkerHandoff schema)
- packages/opencode-swarm-plugin/src/schemas/*.ts

title: Hive Viewer TUI - OpenTUI-based terminal interface
description:
Build a terminal UI for viewing and managing hive cells, inspired by beads_viewer but built with OpenTUI (TypeScript).

## Inspiration
- https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/beads_viewer (Go/BubbleTea)
- https://github.com/sst/opentui (TypeScript TUI framework)

## Phases
1. **Spike** - Learn OpenTUI, build minimal prototype
2. **MVP** - Core list/detail view with keyboard nav
3. **Enhanced** - Kanban, filtering, search
4. **Full** - Graph view, insights, git history integration

## Key Features (from beads_viewer)
- Split view: list + detail pane
- Vim-style navigation (j/k/g/G)
- Filtering: open/closed/blocked/ready
- Kanban board view
- Dependency graph visualization
- Markdown rendering for descriptions
- Live reload on file changes
- Fuzzy search

## Technical Approach
- Use @opentui/core directly (imperative API)
- Read from .hive/issues.jsonl
- Watch file for live updates
- Keyboard-driven, mouse optional

title: Phase 1: OpenTUI spike - hello world + basic layout
Phase 1: Cell list component - scrollable list with vim keys
Phase 2: Detail pane - show selected cell info
Phase 2: Split layout - list + detail side by side
Phase 2: Status filtering - o/c/b/r keys for open/closed/blocked/ready
Phase 2: Keyboard handler - vim navigation + shortcuts
Phase 2: File watcher - live reload on JSONL changes
Phase 3: Fuzzy search - / to search cells
Phase 3: Kanban view - columns by status
Phase 4: Insights panel - blocked count, ready count, stats
Phase 4: CLI entry point - hive-view command
Phase 4: Package setup - workspace integration + build
